sub_topic: Calculating the molar mass of inorganic compounds
message_1: A chemistry student needs to determine the molar mass of aluminum chloride (AlCl3). What is the molar mass of aluminum chloride?
message_2:
To determine the molar mass of aluminum chloride (AlCl3), we need to add the molar masses of aluminum (Al) and chlorine (Cl) together. The molar mass of aluminum is 26.98 g/mol, and the molar mass of chlorine is 35.45 g/mol. Since there are three chlorine atoms in AlCl3, we need to multiply the molar mass of chlorine by 3.

Molar mass of AlCl3 = (molar mass of Al) + 3 * (molar mass of Cl)
Molar mass of AlCl3 = 26.98 g/mol + 3 * 35.45 g/mol
Molar mass of AlCl3 = 26.98 g/mol + 106.35 g/mol
Molar mass of AlCl3 = 133.33 g/mol

So, the molar mass of aluminum chloride (AlCl3) is 133.33 g/mol.
